abstract: When it comes to new and emerging technologies like satellite radio, what exactly constitutes competition?
snippet: When it comes to new and emerging technologies like satellite radio, what exactly constitutes competition?
lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, I was in the middle of a long phone conversation with Craig Moffett, the Wall Street analyst who follows broadcasting for Sanford C. Bernstein & Company. His purview includes the country’s two satellite radio companies, XM and Sirius. Although Mr. Moffett is more positive on XM than Sirius, he sounded a little sheepish when I asked him whether he was bullish on the sector.

headline.main: I Want My Howard Stern and Oprah
headline.print_headline: I Want My Howard Stern And Oprah
